fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The native SAML connector in Jira Data Center only allows for the configuration of a single IdP. This is limiting for certain use cases, especially where external users may be authenticating to an instance via a different domain. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide support for configuration multiple IdPs using the native SAML connector.
 
h3. Workaround 
There are several third-party DC SAML/SSO plugins on the Atlassian Marketplace that allow for the configuration of multiple IdPs.
fields.summary: Provide support for multiple identity providers (IdPs) in native DC SAML connector
JiraHomeHealthCheck doesn't have detailed logging for error path

fields.description:
Currently, editing the permissions of a project does not trigger any event that webhooks. The suggestion is to add an event for when the permissions of a project are modified so webhooks can be triggered.

 This can serve security, logging, and other purposes.
fields.summary: Add event for editing permissions so webhook can be triggered with it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Personal information shared in GET request : user name appearing in the GET request
{{http://localhost:8854/j854/secure/ChangePassword!default.jspa?username=USERNAME&inline=true&decorator=dialog&_=1595499363660}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login with Jira
# Navigate to user profile
# Change password
The same user name is not appeared while performing Forget password from login screen

h3. Expected Results
Username should not appear in the URL. Rather user name should be passed as a POST function rather than GET request. 

h3. Actual Results
Username appears in the URL and violets the GDPR compliance. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User name appears in Change password URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The recent changes in the batched notifications contain bug that prevents the emails containing mentions to be sent immediately. 
This may also create a performance problems on bigger instances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set longer interval, e.g. 10 minutes on /secure/admin/ConfigureBatching!default.jspa
 # @mention somebody

h3. Expected Results
The batched email containing mentions should be sent almost immediately (approx 1 minute).
h3. Actual Results
The mention mail is sent after at most the configured interval period (at most 10 minutes).

Debug mail logging may be enabled to trace the batching mechanism in atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log
h3. Workaround
Set smaller interval.
fields.summary: Batched notifications job for the mentions is executed not frequently enough

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you are using Jira in Finnish and want to edit an issue's due date, the date picker returns a date which is formatted correctly, but is not accepted by the form.

The same thing happens in Romanian, but only for November.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Jira to one of the mentioned languages
 # Attempt to edit an issue's due date (only November is rejected for Romanian)

Note: this bug was found in 8.12.0, but probably occurs in earlier versions too
h3. Expected Results

The date returned by the date picker is accepted.
h3. Actual Results

The form rejects the date.
h3. Workaround

For Finnish, enter the full month name instead of an abbreviation, non-capitalized. For Romanian, change the abbreviation from Noi to Nov.
fields.summary: Correct date not accepted in edit issue FI/RO

fields.description:
Security team has been reporting on security threat due to absence of Clear-Site-Data header when user logs out of Jira. Details follows:

h2. Problem Statement:

Storing plaintext sensitive data in client side local storage makes the data easily accessible by anyone who gains privileged access to the client system. This bypasses user authentication enforced by the application.

In addition to data leakage in shared client environments, such as a public computer's browser, a cross-site scripting (XSS) flaw allows attackers to easily access sensitive data.
h2. Details:

Configure your application to send the Clear-Site-Data header when the user logs out. Configure the header using the following directives:

"cache": clear all cached files for this origin
 "cookies": clear all cookies for the domain (both HTTP and HTTPS)
 "storage": clear all locally stored data, including ServiceWorker registrations and appCache data
 "executionContexts":
 "*": all of the above, including additional future directives
 For example, the header shown below clears cookies and Local Storage.

Clear-Site-Data: "cookies", "storage"
 The header shown below clears everything and reloads all application contexts:

Clear-Site-Data: "*"
 The browser is not a secure storage area. Therefore, it is recommended to clear client-side application data when the user logs out.
fields.summary: Security scanners have been recommending on having Clear-Site-Data header in response header when users log out.

fields.description: As a user of Jira and Slack, I want to get a slack notification when someone mentioned me in a Jira comment so I can get notified (instead of polling) for Jira related information.
fields.summary: Slack Notification event when "I am mentioned in a comment"

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior

When importing projects via CSV, custom fields with the same name, description, and options are creating multiple custom fields to honor project mapping. Jira recognizes it to have a different configuration and thus creates a new field.

h3. Steps to test

# Download the two CSV's and JSON's
# Import the bug CSV with the bug JSON
# Repeat for story files
# Go to the custom field settings
#* Expected results are two matching custom fields are created due to the project mapping

h3. Suggested Option

When performing a CSV import, allow the merging of custom fields that are similar to other fields from previous project imports.
fields.summary: CSV import creates new field for the same field mapped to different projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some device permissions declared by the Jira Server mobile app on Android and iOS are not applicable with current app functionality.  This was discovered through recent conversations with the Server Mobile development team and end users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View device permissions on your device (see [https://www.wired.com/story/how-to-check-app-permissions-ios-android-macos-windows] for instructions)

h3. Expected Results

Device permissions for each app on its respective device platform should only display permissions that are applicable / necessary for the app to operate.
h3. Actual Results
 * iOS app does not need "NSSiriUsageDescription" – permissions should not be listed

Please review other permissions to confirm if they are also required to grant access to certain app functionality.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Some Jira Server mobile app's declared device permissions are not applicable

fields.description:
For example, when using the duration of 4 weeks with a start date of July 27, 2020, it should count Monday, July 27th to Friday, Aug 21st, and equal 20 days.

Currently, for example, Jira will handle a total of 20 working days by configuring the following date:
 *Duration*: Custom
 *Start Date*: 5/Jul/20
 *End Date*: 1/Aug/20

Instead of marking these dates, customer find better if it could mark the dates as suggested below:
 *Duration*: Custom
 *Start Date*: 6/Jul/20
 *End Date*: 31/Jul/20
fields.summary: Start/End Date of Sprints should match the selected days

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira is set to Estonian or Icelandic, the calendar popup used to select dates in the create/edit issue views does not work
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Jira to one of the two languages
 # Create a new issue and try to set its due date via the calendar popup

Note: the bug was found on 8.12.0, but probably affects previous versions as well.
h3. Expected Results

The calendar popup appears, allowing you to pick a date which is accepted when the form is submitted.
h3. Actual Results

No popup appears, the browser notifies the user that "The JIRA Calendar does not currently support your language"
h3. Workaround

Type date in manually
fields.summary: Calendar popup not working in Estonian and Icelandic
Increase Label cache size

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'duplicate key' SQL exceptions for Active Objects tables after XML import and switching database to PostgresSQL
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take an XML backup
 # Switch database from Oracle (for example) to PostgresSQL
 # Import XML backup (is completed successfully) but there are lot of SQL exceptions only for Active Objects tables

h3. Expected Results

JIRA would import the data with no issues at all
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file: Complete [^Stack trace]
{noformat}
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:PostgreSQL
	- version:11.7
	- minor version:7
	- major version:11
Driver:
	- name:PostgreSQL JDBC Driver
	- version:42.2.6
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK_pkey"
  Detail: Key ("ID")=(25005) already exists.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Search for unique Active Objects tables
{noformat}
grep "Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint" atlassian-jira.* | sort | uniq | tail -11{noformat}

 * Use this KB article to fix the unique AO tables
 ** [Duplicate key value errors in logs in Jira Server using PostgreSQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/duplicate-key-value-errors-in-logs-in-jira-server-using-postgresql-958771364.html]
 * Fix sequences by following a recommendation by PostgreSQL's official wiki space 
 ** [Fixing Sequences|http://wiki.postgresql.org/wiki/Fixing_Sequences]
fields.summary: 'duplicate key' SQL exceptions for Active Objects tables after XML import and switching database to PostgresSQL

fields.description: Add an option that logs a user out of the IDP when they logout of Jira. This will prevent the user from automatically logging back in when redirecting to the login page when in primary authentication mode.
fields.summary: Implement SAML Single Logout (SLO)

fields.description: Currently it is only possible to create a number custom field in JIRA with a floating point. It would be useful to create a number custom field without it too.
fields.summary: Ability to create a number field without floating point

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using date picker custom field with the format “YYYY/MM/DD”, and setting a date after 2039 using API call, automatically changes the year to 19XX.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a date picker custom field
 2. Associate the custom field with the project
 3. Create a new issue
 4. PUT the below API call to set the End Date as "2040-01-01"

PUT [http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue/BA-1]
{code:java}
{
"fields":{
"customfield_10700":"2040-01-01"
}
}
{code}
 

In the UI, the representation is 01/Jan/40.  We cannot clearly identify if it is 2040 or 1940. 

We also see the 19XX value when we export the issue to XML. 
{code}
<customfieldvalues>
<customfieldvalue>Mon, 1 Jan 1940 00:23:20 +0553</customfieldvalue>
</customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
{code}


 But when you send a GET call for that issue, you get the result as customfield_10700": "1940-01-01",
h3. Expected Results

Keep the correct date which was set.
h3. Actual Results

It automatically set the wrong year. customfield_10700": "1940-01-01",
h3. Workaround

None

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using date picker custom field with the format “YYYY/MM/DD”, and setting a date after 2039 using API call, automatically changes the year to 19XX.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition: 

Log into service desk and both business template icons are available to select created amongst projects 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to hide Business and Service Desk default project templates without disabling Jira Core project templates plugin. 
h3. Why this is important

Only want to use set templates for projects and not the have the business and Service Desk Project template usable. Does not want to disable core projects template plugin as may impact projects existing. Taking permission away to permission to browse project type does not make icon disappear 
h3. Workaround

Disable Jira Core project templates Plugin
Manage Add-on's -> System -> JIRA Core Project Templates Plugin.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Hide Business and Service Desk Project templates In Projects menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Two dimensional filter statistics gadget's behavior has changed again in Jira 8.5 since it was fixed in Jira 8.0 JRASERVER_66318. If any issues have None value for some custom field, these tickets aren't counted in the gadget and there are no empty values (None) entries shown in the gadget (at least for multi-select-list custom fields).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create custom field with multiple choices (eg. custom field named Browsers, can have internet browser as options - IE, Edge, Firefox, Chrome etc.)
 # Create a simple filter like "project = TEST and issuetype = Bug"
 # Add Two dimensional filter statistics gadget to your dashboard specifying the filter from Step 2
 # Set XAxis = Issue Type
 # Set YAxis = some multi-select-list custom fields (created in Step 1), e.g. Browser(s) field that has Internet browsers as options; Sort By, Sort Direction, Number of Results and Auto refresh settings - seems it does not matter what you put there
 # Save the filter.

h3. Expected Results

Newly created gadget should show complete breakdown, including number that counts issues having None as a YAxis custom field's value 
h3. Actual Results

Newly created gadget doesn't include issues having None as a YAxis custom field's value. There is no row which displays None as a field value followed by issue count (screenshot attached).

 
h3. Workaround

No
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter statistics gadget does not show empty values

Thank you,

Denise

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Batched notifications execute periodical tasks (every 14 days) to clean up old events from the {{AO_733371_EVENT}} and {{AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT}} tables. However, on unknown circumstances, this leads to extremely slow queries on the database if using Microsoft SQL Server. This issue seems to happen more often on older MSSQL versions such as 2012 and 2014.

The issue seems to be related to JRASERVER-65168 where it was described that single column indexes used by Jira might lead to this problem. Even though that specific bug is resolved, it wasn't created multi-column indexes for the batched notifications tables.

(i) The same problem can cause delays in batched notifications delivery.

Example query:
{code:java}
select "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID", "AO_733371_EVENT"."EVENT_TYPE", "AO_733371_EVENT"."USER_KEY", "AO_733371_EVENT"."ACTION", 
"AO_733371_EVENT"."ACTION_ID", "AO_733371_EVENT"."EVENT_BUNDLE_ID", "AO_733371_EVENT"."CREATED" 
from "jiraschema"."AO_733371_EVENT" "AO_733371_EVENT" 

where exists (
	select "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."ID" 
	from "jiraschema"."AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT" "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT" 
	where "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."EVENT_ID" = "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" and "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."STATUS" = 'NEW'
	and "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."CONSUMER_NAME" = 'mailMentionEventConsumer'
	and "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."SEND_DATE" <= '2020-04-29 06:14:41') 
and ("AO_733371_EVENT"."EVENT_TYPE" 
	in (92638,92593,92594,92594,92595,92596,92597,92599,92599,92600)) 
and "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" >= 85125
order by "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" asc offset @P24 rows fetch next @P25 rows only
{code}
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Batched Notifications (enabled by default on Jira 8.0)
 # Have a large number of email notifications occurring daily
 # Monitor the database CPU usage with graphs

h4. Expected Results

The cleanup tasks occur without affecting the database performance, as it does on other DBMSs such as Postgres.
h4. Actual Results

The cleanup tasks take several hours to complete, with the CPU spiking to 100% usage during that period. General slowness is experienced on Jira due to this.

h4. Note

When analyzing thread dumps, we should see 2 Caesium threads running batched notification jobs:
- Thread 1

When analyzing long running queries on the DB side, we should see long queries that look like this:
{code}
select "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID", "AO_733371_EVENT"."EVENT_TYPE", "AO_733371_EVENT"."USER_KEY", "AO_733371_EVENT"."ACTION", "AO_733371_EVENT"."ACTION_ID", "AO_733371_EVENT"."EVENT_BUNDLE_ID", "AO_733371_EVENT"."CREATED" from "dbo"."AO_733371_EVENT" "AO_733371_EVENT" where exists (select "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."ID" from "dbo"."AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT" "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT" where "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."EVENT_ID" = "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" and "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."STATUS" = @P0 and "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."CONSUMER_NAME" = @P1 and "AO_733371_EVENT_RECIPIENT"."SEND_DATE" <= @P2) and ("AO_733371_EVENT"."EVENT_TYPE" in (@P3, @P4, @P5, @P6, @P7, @P8, @P9, @P10, @P11, @P12, @P13, @P14, @P15, @P16, @P17, @P18, @P19, @P20, @P21, @P22, @P23, @P24, @P25, @P26, @P27)) and "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" >= @P28 order by "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" asc offset @P29 rows fetch next @P30 rows only
{code}

h4. Workaround
No confirmed workaround available.

 # Users that have upgrade to newer MSSQL versions (such as 2017) noticed that the occurrence of the problem is smaller.
 # If you're using newer MSSQL versions and experiencing this problem, verify the compatibility mode set to this database. If it was upgraded from previous MSSQL versions, it might be set to mode 120/110, and there was improved query execution on MSSQL 2017 as can be verified on [this Microsoft document|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/alter-database-transact-sql-compatibility-level?view=sql-server-2017#differences-between-compatibility-level-120-and-level-130]
fields.summary: Batching notifications tables can lead to high CPU usage on MSSQL
Need to document Java security policy settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is no permission settings that blocks editing of Time Tracking fields in bulk edit, although all other fields are blocked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user with only browse projects permission.
# Do a bulk edit of any issue.

h3. Expected Results
Only the Comment field is editable.
h3. Actual Results
The Time Tracking fields (Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate) are available to edit, and values of those fields can be changed on the issue.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: There is no permission setting to block editing Time Tracking fields in bulk edit

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If the Jira instance enabled with SSO, creating new users within Jira Internal Directory with an option "Send notification email" will receive an email with default BASE_URL to login/reset password.

But new users can only login to Jira/reset the password using https://<JIRA_BASEURL>/?nosso

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to edit the "Send notification email" template to include additional URL https://<JIRA_BASEURL>/?nosso to inform end user to use it as a fallback authentication method.
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: Ability to Edit or customize Create new user Send notification email template

fields.description:

This window has about 2 or 3 lines only, and is practically unreadable. The suggestion is to make the window a larger size like in this example: 
 !image-2020-07-23-17-34-23-719.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
We currently don't have a REST endpoint to *move* issues that would parallel the GUI functionality. It'd optionally take in a mapping of old—>new workflow states to handle conflicts. 
(There is a *move* endpoint for subtasks, but that's just for reordering them.)
fields.summary: Add REST endpoint to "move" issues

fields.description:
Connecting to an SMTP server that uses STARTTLS is not a strange and unusual circumstance. Simple email applications like Thunderbird handle the set up of these connections without any fuss, yet Jira Server still doesn't support it without moving to the rather fragile JNDI setup involving moving jar files (which currently seems broken BTW as the jar files in the doco do not match the reality in the application.)

I honestly don't know why you don't just handle it.

e.g. SMTP

Server: mail.aserver.com

port: 587

connection security: STARTTLS or TLS or none

Auth method: Plain text (normal password)

username: blah

password: secret

If you can handle that, you can connect to gmail too
fields.summary: Support STARTTLS without hoops

h3. Workaround
# Run the query b below to find out the duplicated value:
 {code}
 select f.name, i.fieldidentifier, count(*)
from fieldscreen f, fieldscreenlayoutitem i, fieldscreentab t
where f.id = t.fieldscreen
and i.fieldscreentab = t.id
group by f.name, i.fieldidentifier having count(*) > 1;
{code}
If there is a duplicate, an example of a result is below:
{code}
              name               | fieldidentifier | count 

---------------------------------+-----------------+-------

 SSD: Scrum Default Issue Screen | assignee        |     2
{code}
 # Navigate to _JIRA Administration > Issues > Screens_
 # Look for the _Screen_ mentioned in the SQL query result e.g. _"SSD: Scrum Default Issue Screen"_
 # Click _Configure_ and look for the field e.g. _"assignee"_
 # Remove one of the fields from the screen.

(i)  If the duplicate field is not shown on the screen or if the screen cannot be opened, the solution is to delete duplicate field references directly from the database.
(!) *Please back up your database before proceeding with this workaround. Also, if possible, test the workaround on a staging environment before applying it to production.*
 The steps are as follows:
 # Identify and write down ID value for each duplicate field reference; screen name and field identifier need to be modified accordingly. For the current example, the ID can be identified as follows::
{code:java}
select f.name, i.id, i.fieldidentifier
from fieldscreen f, fieldscreenlayoutitem i, fieldscreentab t
where f.id = t.fieldscreen and i.fieldscreentab = t.id
and f.name like '%SSD: Scrum Default Issue Screen%'
and i.fieldidentifier='assignee';
{code}
 # Delete all duplicate rows from fieldscreenlayoutitem table and retain only one row.
{code:java}
delete from fieldscreenlayoutitemwhere id = <duplicate_id>;
{code}
 # Restart Jira
fields.summary: Duplicate Fields Are Added To A Screen By An Known Reason

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When upgrading Jira 8 between minor versions (8.6 > 8.8 for example, or 8.10 > 8.11 as another upgrade example), after the upgrade is complete, the admin will see a warning page that explains that some configuration/settings files that contained customizations could not be copied over. This is expected for any startup/installation file where the admin might have made changes. However in this case, the [$JIRAINSTALL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-installation-directory-938847745.html]/bin/setenv.sh file will always appear on this list, even when the admin has made no changes at all to that file.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # install Jira Software/Core 8.10.0 (other 8 versions likely affected)
 # Complete the setup and make sure Jira works
 # Make no changes to setenv.sh
 # upgrade that existing installation directory to a newer version, such as 8.11.0
 # start Jira after upgrade

h3. Expected Results

Expecting that there are no actual changes to that setenv.sh file and the initial startup would not indicate there are when you first start Jira after the upgrade.
h3. Actual Results

Admins will always see that the setenv.sh file as having had customized changes to it that have not been applied to the upgraded install
{code}
The listed configuration files contain custom changes. To keep your current configuration, re-apply these custom changes to the new version of the files during upgrade.

bin/setenv.sh 
{code}

h3. Workaround
* The warning page does not prevent upgrades to Jira in this case. This is just a warning message that appears to be a false positive in most cases. You can still dismiss this and complete the upgrade.
* You can use {{-Djira.startup.warnings.disable=true}} startup flag, (see [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html]) which disables Johnson warnings page entirely:
{quote}Disables the page (johnson) that displays errors after starting Jira if there are only dismissible warnings. The page will appear if there are any important errors.
{quote}
fields.summary: Upgrading Jira 8 between minor versions will always indicate that setenv.sh has customizations that are not applied

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User is disabled in Jira after disabling a user directory in Crowd, even if the user is still provided by another user directory in Crowd.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure 2 user directories in Crowd
 # Add the same user to both directories
 # Synchronize Crowd with Jira
 # Make sure the user has created an issue, added a comment in Jira
 # Disable the first user directory in Crowd
 # Synchronize Crowd in Jira

h3. Expected Results
Jira should keep the user enabled since it is associated to another active user directory in Crowd.

h3. Actual Results
Jira disables the user, striking the name and adding a [X] at the end.
Running another full synchronization in Jira reenables the user.

h3. Workaround
Run a full synchronization again
fields.summary: Changing User Directory in Crowd disables user in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the default language in the instance is set as French or German or Japanese, the batched email notifications looks different. The bug is not reproducible in older versions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the default language in the instance as French (or German or Japanese)
 # Set up outgoing email in your instance.
 # Enable batched notifications.
 # Make some updates in an issue which triggers batched notification.

h3. Expected Results

The notification email should like 'There are 2 Updates' followed by the update
h3. Actual Results

The email looks like 'There is' as in the below screenshot.
 !Screenshot 2020-07-21 at 6.58.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Download and install Jira language pack with updated/fixed translation keys.

Basically download language pack for Jira (in 8.14.0.v20200826125100 version - translations should be backwards compatible so 8.14 should work on lower versions) and install it via UPM.

Basically [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/install-a-custom-language-pack-for-jira-server-295305642.html] but without unpacking and updating translations. The lang pack to download should be named as "jira-core-language-pack-[lang]/8.14.0.v20200826125100/"

Eg. to fix German language download proper "jira-core-language-pack" jar from [https://packages.atlassian.com/maven/com/atlassian/translations/] eg. [https://packages.atlassian.com/maven/com/atlassian/translations/jira-core-language-pack-de_DE/8.14.0.v20200826125100/] and install via UPM.
h3. Note

Not reproducible in older Jira versions like 8.8.1, 8.7.1 or 8.4.2
fields.summary: Batched email notifications format looks different when default language is set to French,German,Japanese in v8.10

fields.description:
When the Customer is trying to configure the field Original estimate, It was misleading 

When we navigate to  congifure field - > Custom, there is no field with the same name. 

As  it is making the user guess that fields are hidden
behind an identifier with no symbolic connection to them: if 'Time
tracking' is an all-or-nothing group of fields, then:
1. the subfields should be listed in the 'Configure Fields' panel and made
to behave as an alias for the parent group's name.
2. Or the fields should have 'Time Tracking' visible in the form -
2a. perhaps attached to a box enclosing the group members,
2b. or perhaps in small text underneath each associated field.
fields.summary: Time tracking should have indicative connection with Original estimate and remaining estimate

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We are using this API [baseURL/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=key&issuetypeIds=issueid&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields|https://gis.nec.com.sg/jira/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=BIKES&issuetypeIds=10201&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields] to get all the fields for a specific issueType.

And some of our clients had an issue with the single/multi select fields as follow:

The user disables some of the allowed values, but the problem here is that the API keeps returning all values even the disabled fields.

In this case, the API call should not return the disabled allowed values or at least return an indicator to help us detect which of those values are disabled.

Kindly assist, and thanks in advance for your help.

Best Regards.
fields.summary: Issue with createmeta rest API

fields.description:
Currently, while configuring SAML with Jira, it is required using an User Directory (internal or LDAP) to manage application access and such configuration must be done upfront, as there is no automated way to synchronize users between internal directories and the SAML identity provider (as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/adding-saml-integration-to-your-existing-user-management-infrastructure-861244976.html#AddingSAMLintegrationtoyourexistingusermanagementinfrastructure-Usingyourapplication'sinternaldirectory]).

The suggestion here is to create this automation, where user creation and update can be done automatically while log in Jira using SAML.
fields.summary: User creation & update on-the-fly with data from SAML attributes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The recently disclosed vulnerability regarding Apache Tomcat

* [CVE-2020-13934|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-13934]

affects the following versions:

    
    Apache Tomcat 8.x from 8.5.1 to 8.5.56
    Apache Tomcat 9.x from 9.0.0.M5 to 9.0.36
    Apache Tomcat 10.x from 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M6

Additionally, the following disclosed vulnerability regarding Tomcat:

* [CVE-2020-13935|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-13935]

affects the following versions:

    Apache Tomcat 7.x from 7.0.27 to 7.0.104
    Apache Tomcat 8.x from 8.5.1 to 8.5.56
    Apache Tomcat 9.x from 9.0.0.M5 to 9.0.36
    Apache Tomcat 10.x from 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M6

We should bundle a more recent version of Tomcat so that Jira is not affected by this in the future.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Check the CVE reports:
** [CVE-2020-13934|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-13934]
** [CVE-2020-13935|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2020-13935]

h3. Expected Results

* Not applicable.

h3. Actual Results

* Not applicable.

h3. Workaround

* Manually upgrade Tomcat according to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-used-by-jira-879957866.html].
fields.summary: Upgrade the bundled version of Apache Tomcat to 8.5.57

fields.description:
Without warning, a JIRA v8.6.0 server fails while synchronising an LDAP directory with the following error:

-  "Unable to find the username of the principal."

The error message does not tell us the username, nor does the error message tell us the principal, and so makes life unnecessarily difficult for admins.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Add the username (or the criteria being used to find the username) to the error message.
- Add the principal (or the criteria being used to find the principal) to the error message.

2020-07-17 14:12:43,132+0200 Caesium-1-3 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] FULL synchronisation for directory [ 10000 ] starting
2020-07-17 14:12:43,208+0200 Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.c.d.l.mapper.entity.LDAPUserAttributesMapper] The following record does not have a username: NameAwareAttribute; attributes: {sn=NameAwareAttribute; id: sn; hasValuesAsNames: false; orderMatters: false; values: [Template], nsuniqueid=NameAwareAttribute; id: nsUniqueId; hasValuesAsNames: false; orderMatters: false; values: [022efe81-76d411ea-a1b6ce9f-216b1919]}
2020-07-17 14:12:43,210+0200 Caesium-1-3 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] failed synchronisation complete for directory [ 10000 ] in [ 78ms ]
2020-07-17 14:12:43,290+0200 Caesium-1-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.atlassian.scheduler.JobRunnerResponse] Unable to synchronise directory
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.UncategorizedLdapException: Unable to find the username of the principal.
fields.summary: Vague error message: "Unable to find the username of the principal." - which username? Which principal?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There's warnings being triggered on the latest Jira versions due to the 'RequestCacheImpl' being used outside of a request thread by 'JMXInstrumentsLoggingService' and 'PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService'. This will not work in the future, so we need to fix it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software 8.10.0 or 8.11.0

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-16 18:21:48,050-0300 PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,050-0300 PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,050-0300 PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,109-0300 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,109-0300 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,110-0300 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Setting the log level of the {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl}} package to ERROR per the documentation [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/logging-and-profiling-938847671.html]

(i) This configuration will filter out relevant warnings as well.

h4. Temporary way to set the package to ERROR (this setting will go away after a Jira restart)

- In Jira, go to *⚙ > System > Logging and profiling page*
- Scroll down to *Default Loggers > Configure logging level for another package*, and add {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl}} package with the ERROR level


h4. Permanent way to set the package to ERROR (this setting will remain after a Jira restart)

- Edit the file {{<JIRA_INSTALLATION>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}
- Add the 2 following lines at the end of the file and save it:
{code}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl = ERROR, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl = false
{code}
- Restart the Jira application
fields.summary: RequestCache being used in an invalid context

fields.description:
It would make sense to allow project administrators to see every comment in the project, even restricted to other roles (as they can add themselves to these roles).

Additionally, it would make sense for them to be able to post comments restricted to any role.

For example, they could direct a comment to the Developers, without being part of the Developers role.

This could even be configurable in the global options.

h3. Expected Results

The formatting will be visible in the Activity stream.
h3. Actual Results

The formatting is not visible in the Activity stream. This happens for Strikethrough as well as Underlining.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After the upgrade on windows from JSW 7.13.4 to JSW 8.11 RC01, the "Jira failed to start" error appears on the screen. However no negative impact to the instance is recognised.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Using instenv:
 # Deploy instenv Windows box with postrgreSQL rds, no application installed
 # Once deployed, install JIRA 7.13 connect to PostgreSQL if needed but I think h2 should be good enough
 # Modify xmx value to 2048mb cause it's the minimum recommended value for 8.x Jira
 # Upgrade to JIRA 8.11, start Jira
 # As soon JIRA starts 'starting up' after the upgrade, open JIRA in the browser and monitor the progress.

h3. Expected Results

Jira starts up normally after upgrade (with a log in screen).
h3. Actual Results

"Jira has failed to start" screen appears after the upgrade.

!_thumb_438800.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

*Note:*

After clicking "Take me to my Jira home", the instance works properly.
fields.summary: Upgrading JSW 7.13.4 to JSW 8.11 RC01 displays error that JIRA failed to start on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The warning logs were added, because starting from Jira 9 it would not be possible to use RequestCache without the context - it's incorrect and slow. Context is necessary for proper creation and termination of the RequestCache. Without it, RequestCache does not behave like a cache - it will fetch data from database for every call. 

It was straightforward task, but with unexpected results. It seems that in Jira DC incorrect usage of RequestCache is very common. So common, that it is flooding the log files of running instances & makes the testing very hard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software 8.10.0 or 8.11.0

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-16 18:21:48,050-0300 PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,050-0300 PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,050-0300 PlatformInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,109-0300 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,109-0300 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] From Jira 9.0 version creation/usage of RequestCacheImpl will throw the IllegalStateException.
2020-07-16 18:21:48,110-0300 JMXInstrumentsLoggingService RUNNING WARN      [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl] Incorrect usage of JIRA API. You can only create/use: RequestCacheImpl inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtil for details.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Setting the log level of the {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl}} package to ERROR per the documentation [Logging and profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/logging-and-profiling-938847671.html]

(i) This configuration will filter out relevant warnings as well.
h4. Temporary way to set the package to ERROR (this setting will go away after a Jira restart)
 - In Jira, go to *⚙ > System > Logging and profiling page*
 - Scroll down to *Default Loggers > Configure logging level for another package*, and add {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl}} package with the ERROR level

h4. Permanent way to set the package to ERROR (this setting will remain after a Jira restart)
 - Edit the file {{<JIRA_INSTALLATION>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}
 - Add the 2 following lines at the end of the file and save it:
{code:java}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl = ERROR, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl = false
{code}

 - Restart the Jira application
fields.summary: Logs of usage of RequestCache without context is flooding the log files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

REST API parameter startAt is not bringing consistently when fetching Custom Fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Execute the following REST using any value at the startAt or maxResults {code}GET /rest/api/2/customFields?startAt=2&maxResults=15{code}
  * Important to say that the two parameters can have any value, the result will never get the right ones.
 Get the following result:
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-08 at 15.28.50.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results

# Execute the following REST using any value at the startAt or maxResults {code}GET /rest/api/2/customFields?startAt=2&maxResults=15{code}
# Get the right number on the startAt and MaxResults at the page.
The expected result would be to get the right values on startAt or maxResults


h3. Actual Results
# Execute the following REST using any value at the startAt or maxResults {code}GET /rest/api/2/customFields?startAt=2&maxResults=15{code}
# Getting the results below.
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-08 at 15.28.50.png|thumbnail! 
The amount of custom fields on the instance does not seem to affect the behavior it was tested on an instance with 16 and another instance with 40 custom fields, the result is the same.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian team,

I would like to raise the change request in Jira server, as for now when we create the user in user management via create user on our Jira server, where we click on an option "send an invitation link", but the issue is that the invitation link is valid only for 24 hours and there is no way to change this default behaviour. Can it be implemented to jira, it really should make our lifes easier. 

E.g. New starter start on monday and I will create his account on friday, so when user receive his invitation mail, the link inside this mail is invalid because 2 days already passed. 

For your information the issue was already in solution in ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37072 and also in service desk [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/20/GHS-194001]. 

Thanks a lot,
Kind regards,

Adrián Bárdossy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading from any version below 8.0 to 8.5.x or above, some customers notice that the labels field becomes non-editable in-line. The field seem to be removed from the edit screen scheme and this prevent editing of labels in-line within the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to replicate the problem so far with a upgrade from 7.13.11 to 8.5.4 with sample projects and issues created, but have had sporadic cases from customers complaining about the same
h3. Expected Results

No change in behaviour of in-line edit of any of the fields in the issue or dropping of the field from edit screen scheme
h3. Actual Results

The in-line edit of fields like labels and priority are disabled.

h3. Workaround
#  Click on the Administration link.
#  Under the Fields section, click on the Field Configurations link.
#  Locate the Field Configuration that is associated with the affected project and click on the Configure link under the Operations column.
#  Locate the Label field and click on Screens.
#  Tick on the respective edit screen and the inline editing would be available again.
fields.summary: Upgarding from versions below 8.0 to 8.5.x or above removes in-line editing of certain fields

fields.description:
Allow us to say that this field is required for this screen but not this screen or work item type.  We understand that we can do this on the validation on the workflow, but that then requires configuring at each project and workflow level and cannot just be done at the enterprise level.

Example: 
 * On a Bug we have a field called found in.  We want to make this required on all bugs.
 * On a Story this is not a field on the screen, it doesn't make sense on the story
 * Both the bug and story have the same workflow as for each team because they are both backlog items.
 * Each team gets to decide their workflow.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of Required Fields per screen

fields.description:
Would it be possible to expose a system configuration option that would enable an organization, if they choose, to enforce that any newly created custom field always be assigned a project-specific context and to automatically delete the global context?

This would never stop a custom field from being reused.  You simply add another project-specific context.

But this would stop the sprawl of custom fields into field configurations across all projects in a Jira instance, and would lessen the probability that, with the creation of each new custom field, we necessarily make Jira slower for everyone.

Because unfortunately not every organization has a dedicated Jira admin or set of admins that force the reuse of custom fields and actively prevent or discourage their creation.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 29 Oct 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

I am happy to announce that this suggestion will be released in Jira 8.14.0.
We will allow and encourage to specify a context upon custom field creation. This change should mitigate problems related to global custom fields.

Thank you,
Szymon Korytnicki,
Jira Server Developer
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Config Option To Require Every New Custom Field to Add a Context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira doesn't error out if we edit the issue type from REST API to a value which is not allowed. Issue with issueType="X" can be changed to issueType="Y" even though X and Y don't share the same workflow if done from REST API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create two *issue types* (_Example:_ "Support" & "TR")
 * Make the two issue types tied to *two different workflows*
 * Create an issue of issueType="Support"
 * Edit the issue Type to TR from REST:
{code:java}
curl -v -X PUT "<BASE-URL>/rest/api/2/issue/<ISSUE-KEY>" --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"fields":{"issuetype":{"name":"TR"}}}' -u admin:xxxxx{code}
 * Resulting issue will not act according to the new workflow

h3. Expected Results

Jira throws error response code as Illegal action
h3. Actual Results

Jira responds with *204* and the new issue type shows inconsistent workflow state and transition options:
{code:java}
$ curl -v -X PUT "http://localhost:8854/j854/rest/api/2/issue/TORF-13" --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"fields":{"issuetype":{"name":"TR"}}}' -u admin:XXXXX
*   Trying ::1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 8854 (#0)
* Server auth using Basic with user 'admin'
> PUT /j854/rest/api/2/issue/TORF-13 HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8854
> Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46Q2hhcmxpZSE=
> User-Agent: curl/7.64.1
> Accept: */*
> Content-Type: application/json
> Content-Length: 38
>
* upload completely sent off: 38 out of 38 bytes
< HTTP/1.1 204
< X-AREQUESTID: 965x1831x1
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
< X-ASEN: SEN-500
< Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=4A90632BC6AF13A8A018C0110904A860; Path=/j854; HttpOnly
< X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
< Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BJ9S-9F4Z-WN42-OUGU_3282c73058e7f3a272003c23c222947d48a6627a_lin; Path=/j854
< X-ASESSIONID: ayfao0
< X-AUSERNAME: admin
< Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform
< Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
< Date: Mon, 13 Jul 2020 10:35:07 GMT
<
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
* Closing connection 0
{code}
!2020-07-13_16-06-17.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

NO known workaround to make jira stop this action from REST.

From customer's perspective below are the workaround options to get the affected issue keys back to working state:
* Run Integrity checker to find affected issue keys
 * Use the same endpoint to set the issue type back to original issue type and then use the UI and *Move* the issue to the new issue type instead of edit
 * Cloning the issue gets the current workflow status(es) and Transition(s) to show up
 * Make both of the issue Types share the same workflow rendering this bug not applicable to begin with
fields.summary: Jira allows illegal edit (issue type) through /rest/api/2/issue/<ISSUE-KEY>

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While running long JQL the Jira UI is not rendering properly

 !Long_JQL.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter the longest JQL in under issues dropdown > search for issues and click on enter

h3. Expected Results

The Jira UI should show the results with and the area where we enter JQL should expand but it's not rendering properly.


h3. Actual Results

The page will not render properly and the output will not be displayed completely


h3. Workaround

Adjusting the zoom level in the browser, as well as resizing the window, can partially allow for the results to be viewed, which can also be scrolled through.

 !Long_JQL_After_Zoom_Out.png|thumbnail! 

Create another JQL filter which refers back to the long JQL filter in question, and utilize that filter whenever the JQL must be performed. (i.e. "filter = 12345"). Changes to the JQL can be performed directly on the original filter, which will be reflected in the new filter.
fields.summary: JQL search box is too narrow

fields.description: Compliance Rules of customers require that every URL in the body is set to use "https". The Jira or Confluence Systems always puts a logo with a http:// link below in the footer. This nonsecure link redirects to the secure "HTTPS" link. We need to replace all the HTTP with HTTPS. Please help us to fix this as we have been notified of vulnerabilities by our security team. Request that you consider changing the http:// Link to https:// in future releases.
fields.summary: Replace all the HTTP links with HTTPS in the logo

fields.description:
Some Identity providers like one login expect authentication requests/responses to be signed by Jira citing security vulnerability. This results in SAML response to throw errors

<samlp:StatusMessage>Signature required</samlp:StatusMessage>

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PS-19785
fields.summary: SAML authentication assertions and responses should be signed

fields.description:

For example <>/"'(){}=-\ can be used as a full name. This is causing problems for a few customers.


Request to have additional validations for the Full Name field.
fields.summary: Filter out special characters in Full Name field

Currently, JIRA has a dropdown list of the available projects, when moving an issue, which let the users to move issues to all the projects they want and have *move issue* permission.

It would be great if administrators were able to customize the Look and Feel of Agile boards, to allow users to differentiate these boards.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the Look and Feel of Agile Boards

fields.description: not

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We are facing an issue when user have a bookmarked page (JIRA admin pages e.g https://<base-url>/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa) and when they directly try to launch the bookmarked URL we see that there is a redirection between sign-on url and Jira url. This redirection keeps going on in a loop. The only way to come out of it is by closing the browser.

Note: Disable websudo does not solve the loop.

Use Case: Admin users sometimes need to sign in with a non-admin user account for test purposes. Eventually, an admin page may be incorrectly accessed, incurring in a loop solved only when closing the browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * SAML enabled:
 ** We used Onelogin and SSO 2.0 on Jira
 ** Jira Internal Directory
 ** We did create a domain on [https://www.onelogin.com/developer-signup]
 ** We set a username matching Jira's username (NameID as Username)
 * Bookmark an URL from the admin secure section, for instance the user management at http://<jira base URL>/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa
 * Open a new incognito browser and sign in using a non-admin user
 * Copy and Paste the URL bookmarked on 2 

h3. Expected Results
 * Permission denied error message, landing at the user dashboard page
 or
 * Permission denied error message, landing at the login page with the URL cleaned

h3. Actual Results
 * There is a redirection between sign-on url and Jira url. This redirection keeps going on in a loop.
 * We can observe the following sequence of URLs:
{code:java}
http://<jira base URL>/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fsecure%2Fadmin%2Fuser%2FUserBrowser.jspa%3F&page_caps=&user_role=ADMIN
http://<jira base URL>/plugins/servlet/sso-logout
http://<jira base URL>/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fsecure%2Fadmin%2Fuser%2FUserBrowser.jspa%3F&page_caps=&user_role=ADMIN
{code}

h3. Workaround
 * Close the browser to interrupt the loop
 * Edit the bookmark, removing the restricted page
fields.summary: SAML Single Sign on URL redirection in loop issue for non-authorized pages

fields.description:
Hi Team,

This relates to the API documentation for Jira Server 8.9.1:

Currently we see the API documentation for 8.9.1 for audit records highlights about the end point: /rest/api/2/auditing/record, but when we try to retrieve the records, it throws the error shown below.

Tried with plane request and also by adding a query string.
{code:java}
http://localhost:8891/j891/rest/api/2/auditing/record
http://localhost:8891/j891/rest/api/2/auditing/record?limit=100
{code}
{code:java}
<status-code>500</status-code>
<stack-trace>java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.auditing.AuditingResource$1.apply(AuditingResource.java:129) at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.auditing.AuditingResource$1.apply(AuditingResource.java:126) at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$6.transform(Iterators.java:785) at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:47) at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection$Builder.addAll(ImmutableCollection.java:434) at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.addAll(ImmutableList.java:849) at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList.copyOf(ImmutableList.java:277)
{code}
However the rest point "*/rest/auditing/1.0/events*" works well and we are able to retrieve the results. So there is a need to update the API reference documentation for 8.9.1 with latest working rest end point.

The older version "*/rest/api/2/auditing/record"* should be mentioned as deprecated.
fields.summary: API Documentation for 8.9.1 for auditing records should be updated.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

keyboard shortcut CMD+ENTER doesn't work anymore when creating an Epic in Issues view
 As per [Keyboard shortcut|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewKeyboardShortcuts!default.jspa] the combination CMD+ENTER should submit a description or comment.
 In previous version of Jira while creating an Epic from the Project Issues view and pressing CMD+ENTER after entering the issue summary triggered the Epic creation screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the project Issues section
 # Clic on the bottom on *+Create* Issue
 !Screenshot 2020-07-08 at 13.05.56.png|thumbnail!
 # Select *Epic* as issue type and after typing the summary, press *CMD+ENTER*
 !Screenshot_2020-07-08_at_13_00_16.jpg|thumbnail!
 # The page refresh and nothing happen while the Epic creation screen should appear

Observe that the issue is instead created *if any other issue type* is selected.
h3. Expected Results

After a refresh the create epic screen should appear
h3. Actual Results

The page refresh and the Create Epic screen doesn't appear
h3. Workaround

Pressing the *ENTER* key instead trigger the Create Epic Screen
fields.summary: keyboard shortcut CMD+ENTER doesn't work anymore when creating an Epic in Issues view

fields.description:
We need to have the flexibility for configuring 'Reply-to' for Jira Service Desk notifications.

*How it works now:*

JSD sets "Reply-to" as per configuration in "Email requests' of the JSD project.
JSD sets "From" as per the configuration of the Notification scheme email.

There could be situations where a customer doesn't want to configure custom email for 'Email requests' (for example, security concern), however would still like to change the "Reply-to" email for the project's notifications.

*Suggestion:*

Have the option to change the "Reply-to" email to match the Notification scheme email ("From" email). In this case, we make sure that we use _verified domain_ of the instance.
fields.summary: Have option to change "Reply-to" email to another verified domain

A new Feature Idea :who the Reporter is automatic the Assigne

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I need to exclude a single member of a team from being able to do a given transition step in a workflow.

Nowadays Jira allows to do that for entire group only, not at user level in a group.
h3. Workaround

[Configure Workflow to allow Certain Group to Perform Certain Workflow Transition|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/configure-workflow-to-allow-certain-group-to-perform-certain-workflow-transition-604537303.html]
fields.summary: Exclude a single user from a given transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, only administrators can disable notifications for changes made through bulk edits.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Add an option for admins to disable notifications on bulk changes for all operations across the system - this would cover bulk operations performed by regular users in the application, as such users can't opt-out of notifications being sent. 

In the past, the {{jira.option.bulk.send.notifications}} property existed (but it seems like it never worked), which sounds like a useful property - this one was removed on through [JRASERVER-15660|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-15660].

h3. Why this is needed:
Depending on the scope of the bulk edit, hundreds of thousands of notifications might get generated by a single user. Today, Jira and the mail server are forced to take the hit if a user performs such a change. Having an option such as this one allows admins to reduce the impact of a big bulk edit without requiring temporary changes to a project's notification scheme.
fields.summary: Allow admins to disable notifications for bulk notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we click on Comment button In Jira projects. It doesn’t scroll up and focus on entire comment box. However If the comment button is already at the bottom of screen, It scrolls up automatically and work as expected. We can reproduce it in almost all versions. I have attached a screen recording for better understanding. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create any issue and add comment so that comment button positions little above than extreme bottom
 # Click on 'comment' screen will not scroll up to show full box.

h3. Expected Results

Screen should scroll up automatically as we click on comment button.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
No errors{noformat}
h3. Workaround

As of now we can scroll up manually
fields.summary: Click Comment In issue view- it doesn’t scroll up automatically

When screening a version from its dedicated page, there's no way (to my knowledge) to set the start/release date.

!image-2020-07-08-13-56-28-648.png!

You can just release it but not edit it, or you need to switch to the backlog view or the view with the list of versions on your project.

To me it will be convenient to be able to dit from this page too.

fields.description:
Hi,

This case is related with https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/20/GHS-191157
The documentation on Kanban column configuration is very clear – Columns are based on global statuses, but user want to decoupling JIRA boards: columns to status 1-1 relationship. 

In agile, we hope we can create any number of columns without being mapped to status, changing status when changing column is optional,  and to track which column a card is in there is a "BOARD COLUMN" field distinct from the status field. It can be used to find where the work item are on the Kanban independently from the work item status and report accurately on work in process.  

Hope the feature can be implemented in Jira agile board.

 

Thanks,

Jing
fields.summary: Configurable Kanban columns other than status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Similar to these existing reports, JRASERVER-47045 and JRASERVER-66204, if a background re-index or project re-index is abruptly stopped due to the node becoming unavailable, it prevents a re-index operation to be run:
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-07 at 5.40.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 

A solution was implemented to unlock index jobs, but this *only works for foreground re-index*: JRASERVER-68616

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve upon the {{/rest/internal/2/reindex/unlock}} endpoint to also detect and unlock project and background re-index jobs.
fields.summary: Ability delete Orphaned Background and Project Re-index Tasks

fields.description: Jira Cloud allows administrators to impersonate users and it would be useful if this feature was available on Server.
fields.summary: Implement the ability to impersonate users.

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to be able to monitor the integration status between Jira and GitHub through the Jira UI, especially on cases where the sync process may be stuck. It is possible for the DVCS syncing process with GitHub to get stuck without any errors being thrown in the log, as the sync itself is still trying to finish. Knowing the status of syncing would make it easier to determine if there is an error and where it is
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to have more monitoring tools at the Jira UI to help monitor the integration between Jira and GitHub

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira Datacenter is configured with SAML SSO integration, and with _auth_fallback_ enabled as per the KB: [Bypass SAML authentication for Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/bypass-saml-authentication-for-jira-data-center-869009810.html], if a user tries to login using <JIRA_BASE_URL>/login.jsp?auth_fallback and specifies a wrong credentials, instead of showing an invalid credential message and/or ask to enter Captcha for security validation, the user is taken to SSO login page.

A similar scenario was found when a user tries to login (the user is already marked as requiring captcha due to multiple previous login failures) and then the captcha challenge is not shown, the user is re-directed to the SSO login page and finally the user is able to login with the correct credentials without going through the captcha challenge.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Installed Jira Datacenter, tested on Jira 8.4.1.
 # Integrate Jira with a SAML SSO provider (Tested with Keycloak).
 # Configure SAML as primary authentication from SAML SSO configuration page in Jira
 # Create a Jira internal user and set the password.
 # Try to login using the URL <JIRA_BASE_URL>/login.jsp?auth_fallback, and specify a wrong set credentials.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should display an invalid credentials message or render a Captcha if the number of failed attempts satisfy the _jira.maximum.authentication.attempts.allowed_ property.
h3. Actual Results

Jira redirects the user to the SSO login page.
 The user is not informed that his credentials are wrong.
 If Captcha is to be used, the Captcha screen is not presented to the user:
 The below messages can be seen in the security log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-07 11:33:02,870 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-22 anonymous 693x2178x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp login : 'jadmin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
2020-07-07 11:33:02,879 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-22 anonymous 693x2178x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp The user 'jadmin' has FAILED authentication.  Failure count equals 1
2020-07-07 11:33:18,268 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-17 anonymous 693x2199x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp login : 'jadmin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
2020-07-07 11:33:18,274 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-17 anonymous 693x2199x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp The user 'jadmin' has FAILED authentication.  Failure count equals 2
2020-07-07 11:33:29,730 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-2 anonymous 693x2219x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp login : 'jadmin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
2020-07-07 11:33:29,739 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-2 anonymous 693x2219x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp The user 'jadmin' has FAILED authentication.  Failure count equals 3
2020-07-07 11:33:44,763 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-21 anonymous 693x2252x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp The user 'jadmin' is required to answer a CAPTCHA elevated security check.  Failure count equals 4
2020-07-07 11:34:05,302 https-jsse-nio-3841-exec-9 anonymous 694x2285x1 1a7euu7 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /login.jsp The user 'jadmin' is required to answer a CAPTCHA elevated security check.  Failure count equals 5
{noformat}
From the UI, You can see the redirects:

!screenshot_472.png|thumbnail! !screenshot_473.png|thumbnail! !screenshot_474.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

If the user manages to remember the password in the first couple to tries they can click back on the browser and try to login again.
 If Jira decides to use Captcha after multiple failed login attempts, Captcha screen is not rendered and there is no way for the user to login on his own.
 The user will need to contact the Jira admin to reset the login count and the Captcha screen from Jira user management.
fields.summary: When bypassing Datacenter SAML SSO, Jira redirects invalid login to SSO login, Captcha not displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"The encoding [binary] is not recognised by the JRE" keeps getting logged in Tomcat log. It occurs quite often and creating a lot of noise in the logs.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a fresh Jira 7.13 instance, without any add-ons
 # Make sure Jira Software is installed
 # Open a new incognito window > select Project > Create project > select "Scrum Software Development"

 OR

Install a custom add-on that will to this warning being logged (one potential add-on is [Back to Top|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212062/back-to-top?hosting=server]). This can be the case in Jira 8.x as well.

h3. Expected Results

Tomcat logs do not log any warning.

Upon selecting the project template, the following gets logged in the logs:

com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:64) at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:37) at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter$1.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:58
{code}

h3. Workaround

Change logging level from WARNING level to ERROR, in order to suppress the message:
 # Edit {{logging.properties}} file in $JIRA_INSTALL/conf
 # At the end of the file, insert the following:
{noformat}# Surpress 'The encoding [binary] is not recognised by the JRE'
org.apache.catalina.connector.Response.level = ERROR{noformat}
 # Save the file and restart Jira

h3. Notes
 * The warning may not appear every time, while attempting to reproduce the issue.
 * In order to have a successful replication, a private / incognito window must be used in order to clear browser cache.
 * Some custom plugins can also cause this message being logged (e.g. we identified this message being logged due to [Back to Top|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212062/back-to-top?hosting=server] plugin). Disabling and uninstalling the plugin is a way to test
 ** A way to test if any other plugin is causing this message to be logged, is to enable [Safe Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/disabling-and-enabling-apps-273875716.html], do a full re-index and check whether the issue still appears in the log.
 * (!) *At this moment, we cannot see that the warning is present in Jira 8.5.x for the Jira Software add-on. However, it seems there is a different cause for this message in Jira 8.x., mainly related to custom plugins being used. In that case, users should reach to plugin vendors and report the behaviour.*
fields.summary: "The encoding [binary] is not recognised by the JRE" keeps getting logged in Tomcat log

fields.description:
h5.Problem Definition
Customers in China cannot access the Google Play app store, so they cannot download the Mobile App for Android. Additionally, mobile phones of some brands (like Huawei) are blocked from using the Google Play app store.

h5.Suggested Solution
Add the Mobile App for Android to other app stores or provide an alternative download method.
fields.summary: Unable to download the Mobile App for Android without an access to the Google Play app store

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira does not provide any internal tool to display usage statistics from Jira items (e.g. How many times a dashboard, board or plan was accessed), so users do not have a consistent way to purge unused items on Jira.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a section on Jira's UI to display this information, allowing users to easily find and remove unused items.
fields.summary: Provide usage statistics for Jira items

fields.description:
When two or more users have long and similar names or users are imported from multiple user directories, the width of the Watcher picker dropdown list is not enough to make a clear distinction.

 

Workarounds involve making use of Avatars or hacking the CSS to increase the default and hardcoded 218px: [How to increase the width of the watchers selection box in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-increase-the-width-of-the-watchers-selection-box-in-jira-1014666975.html].
fields.summary: Watcher picker is too short in width for some scenarios

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Jira has performance problems due to Environmental issues it's hard to collect all required data at the right timeframe. 
Also, having the Application point of view is important, since it helps to isolate other factors (like permissions, QoS, DB Execution plans, etc)

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a testing tool embedded in the product to collect the performance stats (_In-product diagnostics_) related to Environment: Disk performance, DB latency and Query time, Network latency and throughput. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Use  [Test disk access speed for Jira server performance troubleshooting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/test-disk-access-speed-for-jira-server-performance-troubleshooting-818577561.html]
fields.summary: As an Jira Administrator I want to test disk and DB performance

fields.description: Enable wiki syntax "[ ~ username ]" to emit mention notification email to user (according to project/issue/comment permission/visibility) even if "Browser User" global permission is not granted
fields.summary: Enable wiki syntax "[ ~ username ]" to emit mention notification email to user (according to project/issue/comment permission/visibility) even if "Browser User" global permission is not granted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if any configuration changes were made to Jira there is no API to retrieve alerts for re-index by Jira admin.

Jira admin can only view the POPup alert after logged into the Jira.
{code:java}
We recommend that you perform a re-index, as configuration changes were made to ****. Get help!
If you have other changes to make, complete them first so that you don't perform multiple re-indexes {code}
 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a REST API to retrieve alert specific to configuration changes required re-index. So that administrator can execute [Reindex API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.10.0/#api/2/reindex]

h3. Workaround 

n/a
fields.summary: REST API to retreive alert related to re-index when configuration changes were made

fields.description:
When users set Jira's User Directory with "Incremental synchronization" + "Filter out expired users" + "Global Catalog", Jira will run into the problem reported on [JRASERVER-64099|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64099].

Jira should show a warning when users try to save the directory with this combination of settings to prevent problems with the synchronization.
fields.summary: Jira should show a warning when setting User Directory with specific problematic settings
